title: Retro Swimwear Styles
description: From modest one-pieces to the daring bikini, how well do you remember vintage swimwear fashion?

questions.question: Which daring two-piece swimsuit, named after a nuclear test site, caused a sensation when it debuted in 1946?
questions.explanation: The bikini was introduced by French designer Louis Reard in 1946 and named after the Bikini Atoll nuclear test site, suggesting it would be equally explosive.

questions.question: Which 1960s movie star helped popularize the bikini in America when she emerged from the ocean in 'Dr. No' (1962)?
questions.explanation: Ursula Andress's iconic emergence from the sea in a white bikini in the 1962 James Bond film 'Dr. No' is credited with popularizing the bikini in America.

questions.question: What type of modest swimsuit, featuring a skirted bottom, was the standard women's bathing suit in the late 1940s and 1950s?
questions.explanation: Skirted one-piece swimsuits were the modest, fashionable choice for most women in the late 1940s and 1950s, featuring a small skirt to cover the upper thighs.

questions.question: Which company's swimwear brand, featuring a figure of a woman diving, was the dominant swimsuit maker of the 1940s and 1950s?
questions.explanation: Jantzen, with its iconic 'Red Diving Girl' logo, was one of the leading swimsuit manufacturers in America from the 1920s through the 1960s.

questions.question: What fabric revolutionized swimwear in the 1960s, allowing for more form-fitting and quick-drying suits?
questions.explanation: Lycra (spandex), invented by DuPont in 1958, revolutionized swimwear with its stretch and recovery properties, enabling sleeker, more form-fitting swimsuits.

questions.question: Which 1950s and 1960s beach movie star was known for always wearing a modest one-piece swimsuit, even as bikinis gained popularity?
questions.explanation: Annette Funicello, star of the Beach Party movies, wore one-piece swimsuits at Walt Disney's request, maintaining her wholesome image.

questions.question: What type of men's swimsuit, featuring short trunks with an elastic waistband, replaced longer board shorts in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Boxer-style swim trunks with elastic waistbands became the standard men's swimwear in the 1950s, replacing the fuller, longer styles of previous decades.

questions.question: What swimming accessory, made of rubber with chin straps and often decorated with flowers, was essential for women in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Rubber swim caps, often elaborately decorated with rubber flowers and petals, were essential for women to protect their hairdos while swimming in the 1950s and 1960s.

questions.question: What matching men's swimwear set, featuring a Hawaiian-print shirt with matching trunks, was popular in the 1950s and 1960s?
questions.explanation: Cabana sets, consisting of a matching short-sleeved shirt and swim trunks in coordinating prints, were a popular men's poolside fashion in the 1950s and 1960s.

questions.question: Which French actress helped make the bikini fashionable in Europe when she wore one in the 1953 film 'The Girl in the Bikini'?
questions.explanation: Brigitte Bardot wore bikinis in several films in the 1950s, helping to make them fashionable and acceptable across Europe before they became popular in America.

questions.question: What style of women's one-piece swimsuit, featuring a strapless top held up by boning, was popular in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The strapless maillot, constructed with internal boning to stay up without straps, was a glamorous poolside choice for women in the 1950s.

questions.question: What garment did women commonly wear over their swimsuits while walking to and from the beach in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Terry cloth beach robes and cover-ups were standard beachwear etiquette in the 1950s, worn over swimsuits for modesty when not actually swimming.

questions.question: In which decade did the string bikini become mainstream beach fashion in America?
questions.explanation: The string bikini became mainstream American beachwear in the 1970s, with even smaller and more revealing designs becoming acceptable.

questions.question: What high-cut leg style dominated women's one-piece swimsuits in the 1980s?
questions.explanation: The 1980s brought extremely high-cut leg openings on one-piece swimsuits, creating the illusion of longer legs and becoming the decade's signature swimwear look.

questions.question: What was the name for the elegant poolside coat-dress that women wore over their swimsuits at resort hotels in the 1960s?
questions.explanation: Cabana dresses were stylish poolside garments worn at resort hotels and country clubs in the 1960s, allowing women to look fashionable between swims.
